Article Title: Is India bothered about Test debacle?
Article Text:
Sai Sudharsan plays a shot during the fifth day of the second Test in Guwahati. (Image: PTI Photo/Shahbaz Khan)

The team’s hard-earned legacy in the five-day game is eroding fast, especially at home. But with all the focus being on chasing White-Ball glory, right from a cricketer’s junior years, an effective turnaround may require more effort than the stakeholders may be willing to make.

Coach Gautam Gambhir, chief selector Ajit Agarkar need to get their act right

Juniors disinterested?

No quality red-ball players?

GUWAHATI: It was right after Day Four of the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati. India were staring at one of their most humiliating series defeats in recent times, but the focus of the stakeholders of Indian cricket was on something else. A gala was being staged in Mumbai. The schedule of the T20 World Cup was being announced. India’s former all-format captain Rohit Sharma was there, as was current T20I leader Suryakumar Yadav, along with Indian cricket board (BCCCI) mandarins. There wasn’t a single discussion pertaining to the impending red-ball disaster. The stage was being prepared for the next six months of a T20 fest which was going to rule the heads and hearts of Indian cricket fans.India, after their 408-run loss — biggest in terms of runs in their 94-year Test history — have already hit the white-ball button. Coach Gautam Gambhir is with his entourage in Ranchi, so are ‘RoKo’ and the rest of the bandwagon for the ODI series that starts on Sunday.Everyone is hoping that the abject surrender in Guwahati — India’s fifth defeat in seven Test matches at home over the last 13 months — will be a mere speck on the horizon if the white-ball teams succeed.It’s Gambhir’s professional compulsion and he can’t be entirely faulted. “If we have to do well in Test cricket, then we’ll have to prioritize the format. It cannot happen that a week before a Test series against South Africa at home, we are playing a white-ball series in Australia,” Gambhir said after the team’s loss here.While that’s one part of the story, the performance of the Indian team in the South Africa series suggests that the current lot aren’t best equipped to play Test cricket at home. The fact that Simon Harmer, a 36-year-old journeyman off-spinner, claimed 17 wickets in the two Tests underlines India’s frailties in a sector where they were masters of the craft even a few years ago — playing spin.Ravichandran Ashwin, former Indian offie with 537 Test wickets, made a very pertinent point. “The problem of playing spin started a few years ago when the control of the pitches for Ranji Trophy games were taken away from local curators. The focus was on preparing good pitches with pace and bounce and neutral curators were appointed across the country. It allowed many of our new-age players to get better against fast bowling, but they lost their grasp over spin,” Ashwin said.India’s recent overseas record is a perfect indicator of Ashwin’s point. Against Australia Down Under, India lost 1-3, but they were very much in the game till the last session of the fifth Test. In England, the same team that got crushed against South Africa at home played out a creditable 2-2 draw, with the Indian top-order batters getting a bucketload of runs.Over the last four years, the Indian U-19 team has played only three four-day series — two against Australia and one against England. People who want to see India do well in Test cricket are not at all happy with this.The entire focus of the U-19 cycle is on white-ball cricket, with the U-19 50-over World Cup being the focus. It means the Cooch Behar Trophy — the national U-19 red-ball tournament — has lost its importance and sheen.Gambhir has been criticized for choosing bits and pieces allrounders ahead of specialists in the team, but sources in the know say that even selectors at the junior level are fixated about choosing such players.“The junior selectors are rated by what the Indian team does in the U-19 World Cup. So their focus is on trying to find cricketers who can do a bit of both. So right at the grass roots, the players’ technique and temperament are moulded by the requirements of white-ball cricket, because they know a good U-19 World Cup can give them a good IPL contract,” a former selector said, adding that if Chetesh war Pujara was playing U-19s, he would have played only four games a year.Former India wicketkeeper Deep Dasgupta, who does a lot of coaching, feels if India are to become a force again in Tests, they must identify red ball talent and insulate them from white-ball cricket.“It’s basic technique. To be successful in the white-ball, it is important that the bat comes down from the gully region so that it opens up scoring options. In red ball, it is important that the bat comes down straight, because defending is as big a part of the game as attacking.“If we have to produce good players in red-ball cricket, young players with good technique should get financial incentive, be allowed to learn the ropes and stay away from the lure of T20s,” Dasgupta added.Does India have enough good players for international red-ball cricket? With the likes of Sai Sudharsan and Nitish Reddy failing woefully and Shreyas Iyer opting out of red ball cricket, there are many holes to fill. It appears that the likes of Karun Nair and Abhimanyu Eashwaran, too, are unlikely to be considered.Though the next Test assignment is eight months away, one understands that the selectors may look at someone like Ruturaj Gaikwad, whose technique has impressed those who run the game in the country. Even though Ruturaj is a big hit in the IPL as CSK captain, he also has a healthy first-class average of 45.59 and is known to be one of the better players of spin bowling.With Sarfaraz Khan falling off the radar and unlikely to regain the trust of the team management, Rinku Singh is another player whose Ranji Trophy performances should be taken note of. The KKR left hander, a terrific player of spin who turns out for Uttar Pradesh in the Ranji Trophy, has a first-class batting average of 59.3. He bats at No. 5 and his 176 against Tamil Nadu in Coimbatore a few days ago in UP’s winning first-innings chase of 455 was a throwback to the old-school grind.Another player who has caught everybody’s attention of late is Smaran Ravichandran, a left-hand batter from Karnataka. “He has a first class average of 78.3 but the selectors need to see him more in the India ‘A’ set-up. He has played 13 games and the selectors need to see how good he is against the short-ball,” a source said. Among bowlers, young Punjab off spinner Anmoljeet Singh is an interesting prospect if groomed well. Those in the know say that the 18-year-old has the qualities of becoming a good off-spinner even at the senior level, but he needs to be handled carefully.Dasgupta says that it is important that the BCCI starts organizing more camps like they used to earlier. “Why not have camps that we used to have before a red-ball series? Former greats, too, can be called for such camps,” Dasgupta said.The next Test series is eight months away and it remains to be seen how BCCI reacts to the recent debacle and whether it takes corrective measures.
Article Summary: India's hard-earned legacy in the five-day game is eroding fast, especially at home. With all the focus being on chasing White-Ball glory, right from a cricketer’s junior years, an effective turnaround may require more effort than the stakeholders may be willing to make.

Article Title: WPL auction: Shocking! Australian star Alyssa Healy goes unsold
Article Text:
Alyssa Healy (Photo/Getty Images)

NEW DELHI: The 2026 Women’s Premier League (WPL) mega-auction began on Thursday with 276 players listed to go under the hammer. The event opened with a surprise when Australian wicketkeeper-batter Alyssa Healy went unsold. She was the first player in the auction, with a base price of Rs 50 lakh, but none of the five franchises placed a bid.Healy, the Australian captain, recently suffered a calf injury during the women’s World Cup, which caused her to miss league matches against England and South Africa. She has also dealt with a finger injury in the past. Franchises are understood to be unsure about her fitness for the upcoming WPL season.She was bought for INR 70 lakh by UP Warriorz in 2023.The auction features a wide age range. The youngest players are 16-year-olds Deeya Yadav and Bharati Singh, while former South African fast bowler Shabnim Ismail is the oldest at 37.Each franchise can assemble a squad of up to 18 players. Across the five teams, a total of 73 slots are available, including 23 overseas slots.Defending champions Mumbai Indians (MI), captained by Harmanpreet Kaur, and three-time runners-up Delhi Capitals (DC) have retained the maximum quota of five players and have no RTM available.
Article Summary: The 2026 Women's Premier League (WPL) mega-auction began on Thursday with 276 players listed to go under the hammer. The event opened with a surprise when Australian wicketkeeper-batter Alyssa Healy went unsold. Healy, the Australian captain, recently suffered a calf injury during the women’s World Cup.

Article Title: WPL 2026: Fourth edition to begin on January 9; Navi Mumbai & Vadodara to host all matches
Article Text:
Women's Premier League. (Image: File)

Rohit Sharma opens up on 2026 T20 World Cup, wants India to play FINAL

The Women's Premier League's fourth edition will take place in Navi Mumbai and Vadodara from January 9, with a schedule change from its usual February-March window to accommodate the men's T20 World Cup beginning February 7."The upcoming edition of the WPL will be played in Navi Mumbai and the final will be held in Vadodara," announced WPL Chairperson Jayesh George during the WPL auction.The tournament will follow a caravan model, with the first half being played at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai, where India recently won the women's ODI World Cup.The competition will then move to Vadodara for the final scheduled for February 5.Mumbai Indians, who have won the tournament previously, are the current champions of the three-season-old league.The league's new schedule ensures it doesn't conflict with the men's T20 World Cup, which begins shortly after the WPL's conclusion.

Article Title: 'My heartbeat used to go fast': Ashwin questions Rishabh Pant’s shot selection after India’s 0–2 home humiliation
Article Text:
Rishabh Pant

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Gautam Gambhir fiery press conference: On whitewash, Rishabh Pant shot, pitch and more

Poll Do you agree with Ashwin's criticism of Rishabh Pant's shot selection? Strongly Agree Agree Disagree

NEW DELHI: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has offered a sharp critique of Rishabh Pant’s batting approach following India’s crushing 408-run defeat to South Africa in the second Test, a loss that sealed a 0–2 home whitewash and marked one of the national team’s lowest moments in recent years.Speaking on his YouTube show Ash ki Baat, Ashwin praised Pant’s natural ability but said his reckless shot selection continues to let the team down at crucial moments.“My heartbeat used to go fast in the dressing room when Rishabh Pant batted. He has a superb game and defence, so I always wonder why he would get out to shots like these,” Ashwin said. “I will still say he is a very good player, and the day he takes responsibility, things can start changing. I don’t deny the X-factor he brings.”Ashwin compared Pant’s approach to former New Zealand batter Nathan Astle’s iconic double-hundred in Christchurch — an innings he said cannot be used to justify ultra-attacking play in every match. “Astle once smashed 200-odd runs, but he didn’t play the same way in every Test. Similarly, batters cannot play the same way every time. I have said it in the dressing room, but it cannot change until he realises it.”Pant, who captained in the absence of an injured Shubman Gill, endured a disappointing series with just 49 runs across four innings. Ashwin warned that leadership magnifies responsibility: “If you are a captain today, 10 others will follow in your footsteps. Responsibility is a must.”Ashwin also expressed deep disappointment with India’s overall performance, saying the defeat did not hurt as much as the lack of fight shown by the team. He felt the Guwahati pitch was “of Test quality” and said India should at least have taken the match into the final session.“I wasn’t sad about losing the Test, but there was no fight,” he said. “In the dressing room, everyone should raise their hands individually and take accountability.”He added that the current Test side remains “way behind in terms of experience” and will take time to evolve.
Article Summary: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin criticises Rishabh Pant's shot selection. Ashwin says Pant's reckless approach continues to let the team down. India lost the second Test in Guwahati by 408 runs to seal a 0-2 series whitewash.

Article Title: Who is Mallika Sagar? Meet the auctioneer steering the WPL 2026 mega auction
Article Text:
Sports auctioneer Mallika Sagar. (Image: X)

Are selectors confused? First Ravindra Jadeja now Axar Patel | Musical chairs!

Mallika Sagar, born in Mumbai in 1975, has emerged as a groundbreaking figure in the auction world, becoming the first female auctioneer in the Indian Premier League while building a successful career spanning art and sports auctions. Her journey from art history studies to conducting major cricket auctions represents a significant breakthrough in traditionally male-dominated fields.Born into a business family, Sagar developed her passion for auctioneering after reading a book featuring a female auctioneer protagonist. She completed her education between Mumbai and Connecticut, later earning an art history degree from Bryn Mawr College in Philadelphia.Her professional career began at Sotheby's London in 2001, where she specialized in Indian and South Asian art. At 26, she achieved her first milestone by becoming Christie's first Indian woman auctioneer in New York, focusing on modern and contemporary Indian art.After gaining international experience, Sagar returned to India and worked with prominent institutions like Pundole's Art Gallery in Mumbai. Her expertise in art auctions provided a strong foundation for her later success in sports auctions.Sagar made history in 2021 as the first female auctioneer for the Pro Kabaddi League . She further expanded her sports portfolio by conducting the inaugural Women's Premier League auctions in 2023.Her breakthrough in cricket came during the IPL 2023 mini-auction when she replaced Hugh Edmeades after his mid-event collapse. This led to her appointment as IPL's first woman auctioneer, conducting both the IPL 2024 mini-auction and the IPL 2025 mega auction in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.In 2025, she added another achievement to her portfolio by conducting the WPL 2026 auction, further cementing her position in high-profile sports auctions.Sagar's expertise spans across art, cricket, and kabaddi leagues, demonstrating her versatility and professionalism in handling high-pressure auction environments.Her success has translated into significant financial achievements, with an estimated net worth of INR 125 crore. Her income sources include auctioneering fees, endorsements, and her established position in elite auction circles.Through her accomplishments, Sagar has become a prominent figure in the global auctioneering community, representing successful women in both arts and sports sectors.
Article Summary: Mallika Sagar, born in Mumbai in 1975, has emerged as a groundbreaking figure in the auction world. She became the first female auctioneer in the Indian Premier League while building a successful career spanning art and sports auctions. Her success has translated into significant financial achievements, with an estimated net worth of INR 125 crore.

Article Title: World Cup glory to WPL jackpot: Deepti Sharma scores Rs 3.2 crore payday
Article Text:
WPL Auction 2026. (Image: Agencies)

WPL Auction: Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal on women's cricket after India's World Cup win

NEW DELHI: Weeks after she was named player of the tournament in the Women’s World Cup, Deepti Sharma became the most expensive player in the Women’s Premier League 2025 mega auction when she was brought back by UP Warriorz for Rs 3.2 crore on Thursday.New Zealand allrounder Amelia Kerr went to Mumbai Indians for Rs 3 crore. There was comparatively more interest in Indian players, with pacer Shikha Pandey being bought by Warriorz for Rs 2.4 crore, and Shree Charani and Asha Sobhana breaching the Rs 1 crore mark.Smriti Mandhana, retained by RCB before the auction, holds the record for the highest price tag with a contract worth Rs 3.5 crore. Nat Sciver-Brunt and Ashleigh Gardner were retained by MI and Gujarat Giants for Rs 3.5 crore each after getting Rs 3.2 crore in the inaugural WPL auction in 2023. The biggest surprise of the day was Australia captain Alyssa Healy going unsold.Deepti Sharma, who was first bought by Warriorz in the inaugural auction in 2023 for Rs 2.6 crore, was released by the franchise ahead of the auction. Interestingly, she drew only one bid from Delhi Capitals at her base price of Rs 50 lakh.When Warriorz decided to exercise their right-to-match option, they set a price tag of Rs 3.2 crore for Capitals to pay. As Capitals refused to burn their purse, Deepti became the most expensive player of the day.New Zealand allrounder Amelia Kerr fell short of matching Deepti as she was also brought back by her franchise Mumbai Indians for Rs 3 crore. UP Warriorz’s Kshemal Waingankar claimed that the franchise was clear in its planning about buying back Deepti, though her going back to the auction pool just days after a stellar World Cup campaign had raised a lot of eyebrows. Interestingly, with new head coach Abhishek Nayar coming on board, the franchise went into the auction with the highest purse of Rs 14.5 crore. They had retained just one uncapped player in Shweta Sehra wat for Rs 50 lakh.Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal said the Indian cricket board (BCCI) is thinking of adding a couple of teams to WPL. “There is definitely more interest in this WPL auction. I’m sure BCCI is planning to add at least one more team to WPL. Then the home and-away format will be ideal for the franchises. That’s why we see there’s a short WPL cycle set by the board,” Jindal said.
Article Summary: Deepti Sharma becomes the most expensive player in the Women’s Premier League 2025 mega auction when she was brought back by UP Warriorz for Rs 3.2 crore. Smriti Mandhana, retained by RCB before the auction, holds the record for the highest price tag with a contract worth £3.5 crore.

Article Title: T20 tri-series: Dushmantha Chameera's four-fer against Pakistan leads Sri Lanka to Saturday's final
Article Text:
Sri Lanka's Dushmantha Chameera (AP Photo/Altaf Qadri)

Rohit Sharma opens up on 2026 T20 World Cup, wants India to play FINAL

Sri Lanka secured their place in the T20 tri-series final with a six-run victory over Pakistan, thanks to Dushmantha Chameera's impressive bowling figures of 4-20.Pakistan, despite already qualifying for Saturday's final with three consecutive wins, fell short at 178-7, with captain Salman Ali Agha scoring an unbeaten 63.Sri Lanka posted 184-5, led by opener Kamil Mishra's crucial 76 off 48 balls in a must-win game to edge out Zimbabwe for a final spot."Proud of how the boys bounced back," Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said. "Everybody contributed. ... Of course Chameera (exhibited) world-class bowling."Chameera dominated the power play with figures of 3-3 and sealed the victory in the final over, conceding just three runs when Pakistan needed 10.He dismissed Sahibzada Farhan for 9 with a slower ball and removed Babar Azam for a duck. Saim Ayub scored 27 before being bowled by Eshan Malinga, while Fakhar Zaman fell to Chameera.Agha and Usman Khan built a 56-run partnership before Khan was caught for 33. Agha then paired with Mohammad Nawaz for a quick 70-run stand off 36 balls.Malinga dismissed Nawaz for 27 in the penultimate over, and Chameera's precise bowling in the final over secured the win.Sri Lanka's innings began with a strong opening partnership between Mishara and Kusal Mendis after choosing to bat first. Salman Mirza removed Pathum Nissanka for 8 in the third over.Mendis scored 40 with six boundaries and a six before falling to Abrar Ahmed's quick delivery. Mishara maintained momentum until he was caught at deep mid-wicket in the 17th over.Janith Liyanage and Shanaka remained unbeaten with 24 and 17 runs respectively, scoring 24 runs in the final two overs."I think it was gettable with the dew coming in but we lost too many wickets in the powerplay and gave away too many runs in the powerplay," Agha said. "If you give too many runs in the powerplay, you'll always be chasing the game. I would have been happier if I had finished the game but it was good to spend some time out in the middle."
Article Summary: Sri Lanka beat Pakistan by six runs to reach T20 tri-series final. Dushmantha Chameera takes 4-20 as Sri Lanka post 184-5 in their innings. Pakistan had already qualified for Saturday's final with three consecutive wins.

Article Title: DCW Squad WPL 2026: Delhi Capitals Women Full Players List, Team Squad and Updates
Article Text:
Jemimah Rodrigues of Delhi Capitals (Photo by Abhishek Chinnappa/Getty Images)

WPL Auction 2026: Full Breakdown of Every Major Number

WPL 2026 Delhi Capitals Women Full Squad

Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal has confirmed the franchise's intention to appoint an Indian captain for the upcoming Women's Premier League season.The franchise strengthened their squad at the mega auction by acquiring Laura Wolvaardt, Chinelle Henry, Sneh Rana, Lizelle Lee, and Deeya Yadav, while also retaining N Sree Charani."No, no, not at all. I think we are very clear that we would like to have an Indian as the captain. So, depending on who else we land, we already have our mind made up. But let's see what happens, but I mean Laura will add a lot of leadership into the dressing room. But we are clear that we want to go with an Indian captain," said Jindal in the press conference.With Meg Lanning moving to UP Warriorz, Delhi Capitals could consider India batter Jemimah Rodrigues for the captain's role, while Laura Wolvaardt is set to open alongside Shafali Verma."Obviously we went till what where we could go for Meg, but I think in Laura we've got a tremendous player who can fill in those shoes. Not only was she the highest run scorer in the recent World Cup, but she's also someone who's got leadership ability as well. So I think she'll be a great addition to the dressing room I think. We're very excited about our spin attack now with Sree Charani and Sneh Rana both coming in - it's stronger than what we had last year as well."We still have some budget left to go after some more players. So I think its looking like a very good balanced team with Henry also coming in, as she can bowl with the new ball. One of the things we felt we lacked last season or in the last cycle was some explosiveness at the bottom order and she brings that. So with Sutherland, Kapp, Henry and then with Charani, Sneh and then you have Shafali, and Nikki - all who can come in with the ball. We'll have more than six bowling options and we have a very deep batting order. So it's looking good and we've reached three finals. It's time we go one step further and we have to - it's about time," elaborated Jindal.Jindal expressed his views on the WPL's growth since its establishment in 2023 and highlighted how the ODI World Cup victory has generated increased fan interest for the upcoming season."Three years ago, all the owners took a leap of faith into the women's game, and we're so thrilled that we did that and for us when the bidding happened, we were very clear that this is a sport that is only going to go from strength to strength, and to see 446 million Indians watch the World Cup final - more people watched it than they watched the men's T20 World Cup final live, it shows how far the game has come.""I wrote it in one of my tweets as well that the World Cup win in 2025 is the 1983 moment for women's cricket, and I think this season the interest in the WPL is going to be like it's never been before. The number of people who even came up to me and asked me in my office or whenever I go out, say that 'Hey, November 27 is the women's auction. Who you guys going to get, and are you retaining Lanning? Why didn't you retain Lanning? So many questions, which in the last three years never happened. So it just shows the kind of interest."Jindal concluded by discussing his hopes for expanding the WPL with a new team and implementing a home-and-away format."Yes, I think we would love to see the WPL in home and away format as well. This caravan format is okay, but it's not ideal and I hope that and I'm sure that the BCCI is working on it. I think the amount of time that they get is very short and that's why in order to fit the WPL within this window - this is the best and most ideal format. But I hope we get a bigger longer window for the WPL as well going forward. I think it is imminent that either one or two new teams will come in at some point and that's why I think this cycle is such a short cycle with only two WPLs over 14 months. So I'm pretty sure that the BCCI is planning on adding a team, and maybe with that addition, we move home in a way that would be ideal for the fans, for the game and for the growth of the WPL."Jemimah Rodrigues, Shafali Verma, Annabel Sutherland, Marzianne Kapp, Niki Prasad, Laura Wolvaardt, Chinelle Henry, Shree Charani, Sneh Rana, Lizelle Lee, Deeya Yadav, Taniyaa Bhatia, Mamatha Madiwala, Nandni Sharma, Lucy Hamilton, Minnu Mani
Article Summary: Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal has confirmed the franchise's intention to appoint an Indian captain for the upcoming Women's Premier League season. The franchise strengthened their squad at the mega auction by acquiring Laura Wolvaardt, Chinelle Henry, Sneh Rana, Lizelle Lee, and Deeya Yadav.

Article Title: Meet Asha Sobhana, the first crorepati from Kerala at WPL auction
Article Text:
Asha Sobhana

WPL Auction: Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal on women's cricket after India's World Cup win

The Women’s Premier League (WPL) auction in New Delhi on Thursday opened up with a crackle and quickly turned into a blaze as Asha Sobhana became the first Malayali cricketer to breach the Rs 1-crore mark. In a pulsating, seesawing bidding war, the UP Warriorz snapped up the 34-year-old leg-spinner from Thiruvananthapuram for a staggering Rs 1.1 crore, capping one of the most dramatic tussles of the evening.The action began innocuously, after the Delhi Capitals kicked things off at the base price of Rs 30 lakh. But the tempo surged swiftly as Delhi and UP Warriorz traded bids up to Rs 55 lakh.Delhi bowed out, only for the Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) — Asha’s former home franchise — to storm in at Rs 60 lakh, determined to reclaim the leggie who had helped power through their title charge in the 2024 season.But the Warriorz refused to blink. The bids climbed into uncharted territory, and when the hammer finally came down at Rs 1.1 crore, UP Warriorz had clinched one of the most compelling stories from Kerala at the auction.For Asha, the moment was surreal.“I was watching the auction at my home in Thiruvananthapuram, glued to the television,” she tells TOI. “I got nervous during the bidding war...very happy with the result.”The milestone is a natural culmination for the player built on persistence and doggedness.RCB had first signed Asha in the inaugural 2023 WPL season for just Rs 10 lakh — a modest sum for the bowler who went on to claim 12 wickets and finish joint second-highest wicket-taker. Her unforgettable five-wicket haul against the UP Warriorz remains one of the defining spells of that year. Incidentally, she is the only Indian to claim a five-for in the WPL.“It was against the Warriorz two seasons back that I bagged my first five-for in WPL, and now to play for them is incredible. Too many things happening at the moment,” she chuckles.The RCB contract came to her at the right time as she was toying with the idea of quitting the game because of the lack of recognition after toiling away in domestic cricket for over a decade.A die-hard fan of former Australian legspinner Stuart MacGill, Asha's WPL heroics earned her a long-awaited India call-up in April last year for the Bangladesh tour, followed by her T20I debut in May.In October, she ticked off another dream, when she made her ICC T20 World Cup debut in Dubai, and started in India’s opener against New Zealand.But the journey has hardly been linear. A knee injury forced her out of the last WPL season and sidelined her for nearly a year.Far from dimming her spark, the layoff seemed only to sharpen her resolve. On her return to domestic cricket for Kerala, she struck immediately, delivering a Player-of-the-Match performance in the Senior Women’s T20 Trophy game against Vidarbha last month.Her career has been as itinerant as it has been inspirational: stints with the Railways, Kerala, Pondicherry, and then back to Kerala, all while juggling her employment with the South Central Railways in Hyderabad.With the WPL beginning in January next year, Asha stands on the cusp of a luminous chapter — proof that perseverance, patience, and craft can script a heartwarming tale in Kerala cricket.
Article Summary: Asha Sobhana becomes first Malayali cricketer to breach the Rs 1-crore mark. UP Warriorz snapped up the 34-year-old leg-spinner from Thiruvananthapuram for a staggering Rs 1.1 crore.

Article Title: WPL expansion on the cards? Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal says 'BCCI is planning'; pushes for home and away format
Article Text:
Parth Jindal (left), WPL trophy

WPL Auction: Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal on women's cricket after India's World Cup win

NEW DELHI: Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal said he expects "one or two new teams" to be added to the Women’s Premier League (WPL) in the near future, which he believes will help the BCCI shift to a home-and-away format.For the first three seasons and the upcoming fourth season, the WPL has followed a caravan model, with the five-team league being staged across two to four cities. The fourth edition will take place in Navi Mumbai and Vadodara from January 9.Jindal said he wants the WPL to move to a format similar to the IPL."We would love to see the WPL home and away as well, this caravan format is okay, but it’s not ideal. I’m sure that the BCCI is working on it. The amount of time that they get is very short and that’s why, to fit the WPL within this window, but I hope we get a bigger longer window for the WPL going forward," Jindal said, as quoted by news agency PTI."And it is imminent that, either one or two new teams will come in at some point. And that’s why I think the cycle is such a short cycle with two WPLs over 14 months. So I’m pretty sure that the BCCI is planning on adding a team, and maybe with that addition, we move home and away.That would be ideal for the fans, for the game, and for the growth of the WPL," he said.Jindal said India’s recent Women’s ODI World Cup win will increase the sport’s popularity. He said he is satisfied that he invested in the WPL at the right time."Three years ago, we all owners took a leap of faith into the women’s game and we’re so thrilled that we did that. And for us, when the bidding happened, we were very clear that this is a spot that is only going to go from strength to strength. I wrote it in one of my tweets as well that this World Cup win in 2025 is the 1983 movement for women’s cricket. The interest in the WPL this season is going to be like it’s never been before," Jindal said.
Article Summary: Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal expects "one or two new teams" to be added to the Women's Premier League. Jindal wants the WPL to move to a format similar to the IPL. The fourth edition will take place in Navi Mumbai and Vadodara from January 9.

Article Title: Neymar Jr's family business acquires Brazilian football icon Pele's brand
Article Text:
Neymar Jr's family business has purchased Pele's brand rights. (Agencies)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

Poll What do you think is the most important aspect of Pelé's legacy? His records and achievements His cultural symbol for Brazil His influence off the pitch

The legacy of Brazilian football icon Pelé has taken a significant step toward renewed global visibility following the acquisition of his brand by NR Sports, the company owned by Neymar Santos Sr. The announcement was made on Tuesday at the Pelé Museum in Santos, the coastal city where the legendary forward built much of his career and global reputation.Neymar Sr. described the agreement as a milestone for both his company and Brazilian sport, emphasizing the cultural power attached to Pelé’s image.“It’s a very strong brand. We want to enhance its identity and bring it into the present,” he said. While the financial terms remain confidential under agreements with former rights-holder Sport 10, Brazilian media reports estimated the value around $18 million.Pelé—born Edson Arantes do Nascimento—remains one of football’s most celebrated figures in the sport, renowned for leading Brazil to World Cup triumphs in 1958, 1962, and 1970. He holds several records to date, with some of the most notable being the youngest to score in a FIFA World Cup final, and also the youngest to score a hat-trick in the competition.His influence extends far beyond the pitch, symbolising Brazilian creativity and excellence in global sport.Though he died in December 2022, his daughter Flavia attended the ceremony marking the transition.“There are no words to describe the emotion of bringing back a brand that embodies soul, humanity, and love,” she said, calling the moment both honouring and deeply personal.NR Sports characterised the acquisition as a “repatriation” of one of sport’s most important symbols, framing it as essential to preserving and expanding Pelé’s legacy for future generations.
Article Summary: Neymar Jr's family business has purchased Pele's brand rights. Announcement was made on Tuesday at the Pelé Museum in Santos. Financial terms remain confidential under agreements with former rights-holder Sport 10. Brazilian media reports estimated the value around $18 million.

Article Title: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodriguez decide on wedding venue! When will the couple get married?
Article Text:
Cristiano Ronaldo and partner Georgina Rodriguez have reportedly chosen the venue at which they will get married. (Images via AP)

The cathedral from Funchal has been classified as a National Monument since 1910, and constitutes the main religious building of the Archipelago, and is greatly visited both by the inhabitants and visitors of the city. (Photo by Octavio Passos/Getty Images)

Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodríguez have set the stage for what is expected to be one of the most high-profile weddings in recent years, with the couple reportedly choosing a venue that carries deep personal meaning for the Portugal captain. Instead of the grand international locations often associated with celebrity weddings, Ronaldo has opted to return to his roots in Madeira, selecting a site that reflects both history and identity.Portuguese outlets report that the ceremony is planned at Funchal Cathedral, widely recognised as the island’s oldest and most significant religious building. The structure, inaugurated in 1514 and built with local cedar wood, stands as a landmark of Madeira’s cultural heritage. It also sits just a short distance from the hospital where Ronaldo was born, adding a layer of symbolism to the decision.The connection between Ronaldo and his birthplace has remained evident throughout his career. Madeira’s international airport carries his name, and his museum — dedicated to his achievements — is located on the island. His early football steps with Nacional da Madeira unfolded not far from the cathedral selected for the ceremony.As per outlets in the country, the gathering is likely to be intimate in nature, though it will bring together guests linked to Ronaldo’s life in Portugal, Spain, Italy, Saudi Arabia and across the football world. Further details remain unconfirmed.It is also stated in a Jornal da Madeira report that Ronaldo and his fiancée will tie the knot in a Christian ceremony in the summer of 2026.Ronaldo and Georgina Rodríguez began their relationship in 2016 after meeting in Madrid, where she worked at a Gucci store during his time at Real Madrid. Over nine years, the couple have navigated different countries and stages of his career. They share two daughters, Alana and Bella, while raising Cristiano Jr, Mateo and Eva María together.As Ronaldo prepares for a demanding period with club and country — including a busy summer of international fixtures — Georgina continues to build her presence as an entrepreneur and media figure.For Madeira, the wedding marks another moment tied to one of its biggest icons. For Ronaldo, it reflects a return to the island that shaped his earliest years, setting the backdrop for a personal milestone that extends beyond football.
Article Summary: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodríguez have reportedly chosen the venue for their wedding. Funchal Cathedral is widely recognised as the island’s oldest and most significant religious building. It sits just a short distance from the hospital where Ronaldo was born, adding a layer of symbolism.

Article Title: FIFA World Cup 2026 Draw Explained: Top seeds split to ensure blockbuster semi-finals in new 48-team format
Article Text:
FIFA World Cup Trophy (AP Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

With 1/10th The Population Of Noida, Curacao Qualifies For FIFA World Cup

Here are the confirmed pots:

Pot 1: Canada, Mexico, United States, Spain, Argentina, France, England, Brazil, Portugal, Netherlands, Belgium, Germany

Pot 2: Croatia, Morocco, Colombia, Uruguay, Switzerland, Japan, Senegal, Iran, South Korea, Ecuador, Austria, Australia

Pot 3: Norway, Panama, Egypt, Algeria, Scotland, Paraguay, Tunisia, Ivory Coast, Uzbekistan, Qatar, South Africa

Pot 4: Jordan, Cape Verde, Ghana, Curaçao, Haiti, New Zealand, European playoff winners A–D, Inter-confederation playoff winners 1–2

FIFA has unveiled the seeding pots and draw procedures for the 2026 World Cup — the first-ever 48-team edition — confirming a major structural change that will keep the world’s top four teams apart until the semi-finals. The announcement, made on Tuesday, sets the stage for a historic draw scheduled for December 5 in Washington DC.Under the new system, the four highest-ranked teams — Spain (No. 1), Argentina (No. 2), France (No. 3), and England (No. 4) — will be placed in two different halves of the knockout bracket, ensuring they cannot face each other before the last four if all win their groups. The move aims to maintain competitive balance and increase the chances of heavyweight clashes deep into the tournament.All four top-ranked teams have been placed in Pot 1, alongside co-hosts Canada, Mexico, and the United States, and other global giants including Brazil, Portugal, Netherlands, Belgium, and Germany, who narrowly held on to a seeded spot.FIFA confirmed that the draw will start with the 12 teams in Pot 1 before proceeding sequentially through Pots 2, 3, and 4.The expanded format means the tournament will feature 12 groups of four, with the top two from each group — plus the eight best third-placed teams — progressing to a new 32-team knockout stage.Six places remain unfilled, with 18 teams still battling in the March play-offs. Among them is four-time world champion Italy, currently in the playoffs and facing the possibility of landing in Pot 4 despite being ranked 12th in the world.The expanded draw also features several debutant nations. Uzbekistan headline Pot 3, while Jordan, Cape Verde, and Curaçao sit in Pot 4 along with potential playoff winners.With the biggest World Cup in history just over a year away, the December 5 draw promises the first real glimpse of football’s new global era.
Article Summary: FIFA has unveiled the seeding pots and draw procedures for the 2026 World Cup. The first-ever 48-team edition will be held in South Africa. The draw will take place on December 5 in Washington DC. All four top-ranked teams have been placed in Pot 1, alongside co-hosts Canada, Mexico and the United States.

Article Title: Estevão’s solo brilliance lifts Chelsea to dominant win over 10-man Barcelona
Article Text:
Chelsea's Estevao, second right, celebrates with his teammates (Bradley Collyer/PA via AP)

A night marked by wholesale rotations, defensive mistakes and a moment of teenage brilliance saw both Manchester City and Barcelona fall to damaging Champions League defeats on Tuesday. While 18-year-old Estevão lit up Stamford Bridge with a stunning solo effort, lapses at the back hurt both European heavyweights.Pep Guardiola’s 100th Champions League match in charge of City turned sour as Bayer Leverkusen punished a heavily changed side with a 2-0 win. Guardiola rested almost his entire starting XI from the weekend loss to Newcastle, including Erling Haaland, but the reshuffle backfired. Alejandro Grimaldo put Leverkusen ahead in the 23rd minute with a precise low finish, before Patrik Schick doubled the lead with a well-placed header in the 54th.“It feels wonderful and we gave everything till the last second,” Schick told DAZN.Barcelona’s night was even more chaotic. Chelsea cruised to a 3-0 victory at Stamford Bridge, helped by Jules Koundé steering the ball into his own net after a defensive mix-up in the 27th minute. Things worsened when Ronald Araújo collected a second yellow just before half-time for a reckless challenge on Marc Cucurella.Chelsea took full advantage. Estevão shrugged off two defenders to score a superb solo goal in the 55th, and Liam Delap added a third from close range in the 73rd.Barcelona have now lost four of their last 10 matches across competitions, leaving coach Hansi Flick under mounting scrutiny.The results left the top end of the table unchanged. A City win would have pushed them higher, but Wednesday’s fixtures featuring Bayern Munich, Arsenal and Inter Milan will now shape the standings. Borussia Dortmund climbed to fourth, Chelsea moved into fifth, and both clubs sit level with City on 10 points. Barcelona slid to 15th, while Juventus rose to 21 points as their revival continued.There was better news for José Mourinho, who finally secured his first Champions League victory with Benfica. Samuel Dahl smashed in a sixth-minute volley and Leandro Barreiro sealed a 2-0 win at Ajax, who remain winless after five games and have managed just one victory in their last 10 overall.Elsewhere, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang struck twice in four minutes to lead Marseille to a 2-1 comeback win over Newcastle. Dortmund snapped a three-game winless stretch with a commanding 4-0 victory over 10-man Villarreal, powered by a brace from Serhou Guirassy.Juventus edged Bodo/Glimt 3-2 in the Arctic Circle, needing a stoppage-time finish from Jonathan David after the hosts equalised late. Substitute Kenan Yildiz was involved in all three goals.Union Saint-Gilloise edged Galatasaray 1-0 through Promise David, with the Turkish side missing injured top scorer Victor Osimhen and ending the match with 10 men after youngster Arda Ünyay was dismissed.Scott McTominay continued his scoring run by netting the opener in Napoli’s 2-0 win over Qarabag. Qarabag’s Kevin Medina was briefly knocked unconscious after being struck by another McTominay effort but was later replaced. Napoli supporters also marked the fifth anniversary of Diego Maradona’s passing.Finally, Athletic Bilbao’s goalless draw with Slavia Prague kept both teams outside the qualification spots with five matches played.
Article Summary: Pep Guardiola's 100th Champions League match in charge of City turned sour as Bayer Leverkusen punished a heavily changed side with a 2-0 win. Chelsea cruised to a 3-0 victory at Stamford Bridge, helped by Jules Koundé steering the ball into his own net after a defensive mix-up. Barcelona have now lost four of their last 10 matches across competitions, leaving coach Hansi Flick under mounting scrutiny.

Article Title: Right structure required to take Indian football forward: Ireland coach Heimir Hallgrimsson
Article Text:
Heimir Hallgrimsson

CHENNAI: Indian football is at an all-time low. The top-tier leagues are yet to kick off for the season, and the players have no option but to plead to the national federation, at a time when they must be putting on a show on the pitch.In a period when much ink has been spilt on the country’s football ecosystem, Republic of Ireland head coach Heimir Hallgrimsson stressed that a structure must be built to reap rewards in the future. Hallgrimsson, who recently guided Ireland to the World Cup playoffs, has a fair idea of Indian football, considering his association with Sports For Life (SFL), a platform for grassroots sports development.“Football is not a new sport in India, but there is not much experience that one can tap into. Obviously, a football culture is not there. So, people in charge may not have been in the game or played the game at an elite level. We, as coaches, can only teach what we know. That is a weakness which needs to be assessed,” Hallgrimsson, the global ambassador and football mentor for the SFL, told TOI during a virtual interaction.While there is a feeling of doom and gloom in Indian football, Hallgrimsson remarked that it is not impossible for the country to create a superstar if a structure is put in place.“In India, football is growing really fast, like everywhere else in the world. If it (work) is done properly, the next big one can come from India. If there is a good structure, it is kind of unlikely that there will be no big football players from India. I do not know when, but it will happen at some point of time. If we start early, we may have a big name in the game in 10 to 12 years,” added Hallgrimsson, a former Iceland and Jamaica coach.Talking about his work at the SFL, Hallgrimsson said: “I like the project. I have a really broad spectrum of coaching; I have done a lot of seminars for coaches in Iceland. So, I am trying to help the SFL and ensure that they do not take the wrong step like many have done.”
Article Summary: Heimir Hallgrimsson says Indian football needs a structure to reap rewards in the future. The Republic of Ireland head coach is a global ambassador for Sports For Life (SFL) The SFL is a platform for grassroots sports development in India. The former Iceland and Jamaica coach believes there will be a big name in the game in 10 to 12 years.

Article Title: Idrissa Gueye sent off for striking teammate — only the third such incident in EPL history
Article Text:
Everton's Idrissa Gueye, centre, gets a red card. (AP Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

FIFA Fever: Fans Go WILD As Scotland Qualifies For Dramatic World Cup Return After 28 Years

Lee Bowyer vs Kieron Dyer (Newcastle, 2005)

Ricardo Fuller vs Andy Griffin (Stoke City, 2008)

Everton midfielder Idrissa Gueye entered an unwanted chapter of Premier League history on Monday, becoming part of only the third incident in which a player has been sent off for an offence against his own teammate — with four players now shown red cards across these rare flashpoints. The bizarre moment unfolded during Everton’s 1–0 win over Manchester United at Old Trafford, overshadowing the result and sparking widespread debate across football circles.The flashpoint came in the 13th minute with the score at 0–0. Moments after Gueye lost possession inside his own box — leading to a Bruno Fernandes effort — the midfielder and defender Michael Keane got into a heated argument. As the two confronted each other face-to-face, Keane appeared to shove Gueye, prompting the Senegal international to retaliate with a left-handed slap to his teammate’s face.Referee Tony Harrington immediately issued a straight red card, a decision later confirmed by VAR, which deemed the action a “clear strike to the face.” Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford and teammate Iliman Ndiaye quickly stepped in to separate the players.Gueye’s dismissal puts him in rare company — only two other incidents in Premier League history have seen players sent off for striking their own teammate.In one of the Premier League’s most infamous meltdowns, Bowyer and Dyer fought each other during Newcastle’s 3–0 defeat to Aston Villa. Both players were sent off, with Dyer handed a three-match ban and Bowyer suspended for seven games.With Stoke leading West Ham 1–0, Fuller slapped captain Andy Griffin after blaming him for an equaliser. He was immediately dismissed, and the incident derailed Stoke’s momentum as West Ham went on to score a late winner.Gueye’s red card, though unprecedented in Everton’s modern history, now joins those notorious moments.
Article Summary: Everton midfielder Idrissa Gueye was sent off against Manchester United. The Senegal international was shown a straight red card for striking Michael Keane in the face. Only two other incidents in Premier League history have seen players sent off for striking their own teammate. Lee Bowyer vs Kieron Dyer and Ricardo Fuller vs Andy Griffin are the other two.

Article Title: Chaos at Old Trafford! Everton win 1-0 despite Idrissa Gueye’s red card drama
Article Text:
Idrissa Gana Gueye of Everton is shown a red card by Referee Tony Harrington after clashing with teammate Michael Keane (Photo by Alex Livesey/Getty Images)

Everton secured a 1-0 victory against Manchester United at Old Trafford on Monday in a Premier League match marked by Everton's Idrissa Gueye receiving a red card for striking his teammate Michael Keane. Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall's 29th-minute goal proved decisive, as the 10-man Everton team successfully defended their lead despite United's dominant second-half performance.The match took an unexpected turn in the 13th minute when Gueye, frustrated with Keane's apparent failure to receive his pass inside the Everton penalty box, confronted his teammate. After Bruno Fernandes missed a shot, Keane shoved Gueye, who responded by slapping Keane's face, resulting in referee Tony Harrington showing a red card for violent conduct."The referee's call of red card to Gueye for violent conduct was checked and confirmed by VAR — with the action deemed to be a clear strike to the face of Keane," the league announced on social media.Gueye became the first Premier League player to be sent off for fighting with a teammate since Stoke City's Ricardo Fuller clashed with Andy Griffin in 2008."I think it was just a moment of madness," Dewsbury-Hall said. "It was avoidable but Idrissa has apologized to us all at full-time and said his piece. We move on from it. The reaction from the lads after that is unbelievable. We could easily have crumbled and lost the game comfortably and if anything it made us grow as a team."Gueye later apologized on Instagram: "What happened does not reflect who I am or the values I stand for. Emotions can run high, but nothing justifies such behavior. I'll make sure it never happens again.""They were the better team, with 11 players or 10," United coach Ruben Amorim admitted. "I felt from the first minute that we were not there with the same intensity so they deserve the win. If they have 10, let's push the opponent to the final third. We need to be near on the transition. We needed to be focused. We need to do more."Despite being down to 10 men, Everton took the lead through Dewsbury-Hall's impressive 18-meter strike. Manchester United dominated the remainder of the match with 25 shots on goal compared to Everton's three."I will sleep well tonight," Dewsbury-Hall said. "I am so thankful we got the three points."The victory marked David Moyes' first win as a visiting coach at Old Trafford in the Premier League after 18 unsuccessful attempts."I'm incredibly proud of the players and the fans," Moyes said. "We got over the line with 10 men. We started the ball brilliantly well, got the sending off, the game changed. But we showed resilience. Manchester United are in pretty good form at the moment, so it was never going to be an easy game. Good goalkeeping when we needed it. The boys were brave."The result ended United's unbeaten run, marking their first defeat since a 3-1 loss to Brentford almost two months ago. It was also the first time in 47 Premier League games that a visiting team won at Old Trafford with 10 men.Jordan Pickford's outstanding performance in goal helped secure the historic victory for Everton.
Article Summary: Everton defeated Manchester United 1-0 at Old Trafford on Monday. Idrissa Gueye was shown a red card for striking teammate Michael Keane. Kiernan Dewsbury- Hall's 29th-minute goal proved decisive for the Toffees.

Article Title: India’s football apex body enforces SC order, bars officials from holding posts in both national and state units
Article Text:
AIFF

The All India Football Federation (AIFF) has implemented a key constitutional clause following a Supreme Court directive. This clause prevents officials from simultaneously holding positions in both national and state football organisations.The Supreme Court had instructed AIFF to adopt Article 25.3 (c) and (d) within three weeks of its October 15 order. These articles specifically prevent executive committee members of the national body from holding state association positions.The current AIFF administration, led by President Kalyan Chaubey, will not be affected by this change until their term ends in September 2026."The All India Football Federation (AIFF) on Monday formally adopted Article 25.3 (c) and (d) of the Constitution as directed by the Supreme Court (SC) of India, pursuant to its order dated October 15, 2025," stated the national federation.These constitutional articles clearly state that AIFF executive committee office bearers cannot simultaneously hold positions in state associations."The AIFF Constitution is now in accordance with the directions of the Hon'ble Supreme Court of India and the framework recommended by Justice (Retd) L Nageswara Rao. With this, a matter pending since 2017 stands conclusively resolved," AIFF said in a statement."The AlFF expresses its sincere appreciation and gratitude to all stakeholders and contributors whose time, effort, and cooperation were integral to the successful completion of this process.In alignment with the statutes of FIFA and the AFC, the AIFF remains committed to its mandate to develop, govern, and promote football across India."The AIFF approved these changes during a virtual Special General Meeting.Previously, on October 12, the AIFF had adopted the Supreme Court-approved constitution but had excluded two controversial articles: 23.3 and 25.3 (c) and (d), awaiting further court direction.The Supreme Court had approved the draft constitution on September 19, prepared by former judge L Nageswara Rao, with some modifications. The federation was given four weeks to adopt it.Two specific clauses caused concerns among top officials. These related to requiring Supreme Court approval for amendments and the prohibition of dual positions in national and state units.The Supreme Court bench, consisting of Justices PS Narasimha and Joymalya Bagchi, validated the current executive committee's election under President Chaubey. They determined that new elections were unnecessary given the one-year remaining tenure.
Article Summary: The All India Football Federation (AIFF) has implemented a key constitutional clause following a Supreme Court directive. This clause prevents officials from simultaneously holding positions in both national and state football organisations. The Supreme Court had instructed AIFF to adopt Article 25.3 (c) and (d) within three weeks of its October 15 order.

Article Title: Erik Spoelstra reaches 800 wins as Miami Heat narrowly defeat Milwaukee Bucks in thrilling NBA Cup battle
Article Text:
Erik Spoelstra hit another milestone (Image via NBA)

Miami Heat ends Milwaukee Bucks’ perfect NBA Cup run, as Erik Spoelstra hits historic milestone

Eric Spoelstra opened up about his historic 800th win

Erik Spoelstra, the coach of the Miami Heat, celebrated his 800th victory. This happened during the NBA Cup game on Wednesday night, when Tyler Herro scored 29 points, Bam Adebayo finished with 17 points and 11 rebounds, and the Miami Heat defeated the Milwaukee Bucks 106-103.After the Heat defeated the Bucks in an Emirates NBA Cup 2025 Group Play game, Miami coach Spoelstra was taken aback by the sight of water bottles being thrown at him from every direction in a happy locker room.Miami has moved to 3-1 in Cup games and 9-1 at home this season with two goals from Norman Powell, Andrew Wiggins, and Kel'el Ware. If Milwaukee defeats New York on Friday, Miami will win Group C. If the Knicks prevail, the Heat will require assistance to go to the quarterfinals.Milwaukee's Ryan Rollins scored 26 points, while Myles Turner scored 24 and Gary Trent Jr. scored 15. Giannis Antetokounmpo has missed the last four of the Bucks' six consecutive losses. Along with Jerry Sloan and Gregg Popovich, Spoelstra is the third coach in NBA history to reach 800 wins with just one team during the regular season.Spoelstra had no idea what was happening. He said Wednesday night:“I was very confused.. I was calculating that maybe we’ve qualified for the Cup. Then I’m looking around and nobody else is getting water dumped on them, and I’m like, ‘Wait a minute — what’s going on here?’”Spoelstra discovered the milestone at that point. He then said:“It hasn’t sunk in yet because I wasn’t aware of it. It’s fitting that it comes on the eve of Thanksgiving..I just feel incredible gratitude for this organization and all of these years. I’m having a hell of a time. I love what I do, I love coaching, I love this profession, I love working for this organization, I love working for — and with — amazing players and staff.”The Bucks were 10-0 in that round of games since the tournament. Milwaukee lost an NBA Cup group stage game for the first time. As of Wednesday, Bucks coach Doc Rivers has an 8-0 record in Cup games.However, the Heat haven't missed a day of work, and Spoelstra hasn't either. Heat guard Tyler Herro said:“It’s huge. I’m trying to think of how old I was when Spo probably got his first one and then to be where he is now — he’s got 800 of them — is insane.. It’s great to be a part of a great organization who’s historically been one of the top.”It turns out that Spoelstra was unaware of the achievement. He is currently 33 victories away from 16th place. On the other hand, Miami is currently in third position in the Eastern Conference standings after winning six straight games.Also read: Miami Heat vs Golden State Warriors (11-19-2025) game preview: When and where to watch, expected lineup, injury report, prediction, and more
Article Summary: Miami Heat defeated Milwaukee Bucks 106-103 in NBA Cup 2025 Group Play game. Heat coach Erik Spoelstra celebrated his 800th win with the Heat. He is the third coach in NBA history to reach 800 wins with just one team during the regular season.

Article Title: When is Stephen Curry returning? Sudden injury setback puts NBA legend and Golden State Warriors in tight spot
Article Text:
Stephen Curry might not return soon (Image via NBA)

Stephen Curry’s injury puts Golden State Warriors in a tough spot

Golden State Warriors is going to have a tough week without Stephen Curry

After injuring his right quadriceps, Stephen Curry hobbled off the bench late in Golden State's 104-100 loss to the Houston Rockets on Wednesday night. To ascertain his condition, an MRI of the issue will be performed. Curry will now be absent from the Warriors for the next week or so.According to sources cited by ESPN's Shams Charania and Anthony Slater on Thursday, Golden State anticipates Curry missing "a week or a little more" due to a quad contusion that he suffered. Additionally, fantasy managers should anticipate missing at least three games due to Curry's initial schedule.According to Charania and Slater, Steph Curry seems to have escaped a serious injury, which is fantastic news for the Warriors. Following Wednesday's game, Warriors coach Steve Kerr informed the media that Curry would have an MRI.Charania wrote on X:“The Golden State Warriors anticipate Stephen Curry will miss around a week or a little more with a quad contusion suffered Wednesday night, sources tell me and @anthonyVslater. He's believed to have avoided any serious issue. Return will depend on how quad responds to treatment…”Given that Curry may be sidelined for a while, the Warriors will need to reorganize. Coach Steve Kerr said:“It obviously changes everything, our rotations, how we’re playing, who we’re playing through, so we’ll see..When I heard it was a quad I was actually kind of relieved, better than an ankle or a knee, so hopefully he can recover quickly and be OK. But we’ve got to hold down the fort.”After the game, Kerr claimed to have seen Curry struggling. The two-time MVP finished with seven rebounds, five assists, 14 points on 4-for-13 shooting, and seven of the Warriors' 16 mistakes that resulted in 22 points for Houston.Rookie Will Richard said:“That’s a challenge, if Steph is out everybody else has to kind of improve their game a lot to fill that void.”Jimmy Butler pushed everyone to "care more" about the details, particularly if Curry isn't there. He said that "it's just sad" that the Warriors occasionally don't execute their game plan and do the small things.He continued:“What will change the most? I think we’re going to have to be damn near perfect. We ain’t going to have the ultimate bailout on our team, but even when he is on the floor we’re going to have to do our job because we make the game real difficult…”He further said:“As great as a basketball player as he is he has a really hard job every single day, he’s got to be the Batman of all Batmans and save us every night. That ain’t what he’s here to do.”On the other hand, Curry got hurt late in the fourth quarter of the game against the Rockets. Although he played despite the injury at first, he had to go to the locker room in the closing minutes of the defeat.If Curry misses exactly one week, he won't play in the Warriors' next three games. He might miss the Saturday at home against the New Orleans Pelicans, Tuesday, December 2, at home against the Oklahoma City Thunder, and Thursday, December 4, on the road against the Philadelphia 76ers.Also read: Is Stephen Curry out of NBA 2025- 26 season? NBA icon’s sudden injury puts Golden State Warriors future in jeopardy
Article Summary: Golden State Warriors is going to have a tough week without Stephen Curry. Curry got hurt late in the fourth quarter of the game against the Rockets. The two- time MVP finished with seven rebounds, five assists, 14 points on 4-for-13 shooting, and seven of the Warriors' 16 mistakes.

Article Title: Dwight Howard creates touching Thanksgiving moment for two surprised women
Article Text:
Dwight Howard created viral Thanksgiving moment (Image via NBA)

Dwight Howard mixes humor and kindness in viral Thanksgiving gesture that steals the spotlight

This isn't the only time Dwight Howard's philanthropic nature grabbed attention

Dwight Howard has always celebrated Thanksgiving with or without his family. Years ago, Howard and the Howard family got together to serve a special Thanksgiving meal to the youth of Southwest Atlanta. Harry The Hawk and the Hawks Cheerleaders also joined them during the special moment.This year was no exception. With a touching gesture, the NBA icon jump started Thanksgiving for two women by buying groceries for them. When Thanksgiving finally arrived, he went outside to share the joy and rejoice with others. He then posted a video on Instagram showing himself browsing the shopping aisles and lending helping hand to others.In the viral Instagram clip, which Howard shared, he could be seen approaching the lady with a smile. He then said:“I wanted to spread love to some people today and pay for their groceries. Yeah, so, you know, I don't know if you would mind that or not, you know…”Confused and possibly not being able to recognize the NBA legend, the woman, asked:“Sure. You on Instagram? YouTuber?”Dwight, keeping a perfectly straight face, replied:“Yeah, I used to be on OnlyFans but I gave up that life.”Surprised, she continued:“Okay. You didn’t play basketball ever? I thought about it.”Then, Dwight dismissed it with a laugh and paid her bill. Later, as he went down the aisle, he saw another customer. He then did the same and offered to pay for her groceries as well. She clapped joyfully, surprised and happy. The caption of the video read:“What are you grateful for this thanksgiving..”Additionally, he also celebrated the holiday along with his teammates. In 2022, despite missing time due to a knee injury, Howard celebrated Thanksgiving and bonded with his colleagues over karaoke. He performed the beloved song from the 1980s, "We Are the World." In the viral clips, he looked extremely satisfied.Helping others on Thanksgiving is not an isolated incident for Howard. Years ago, he and his family members fed the children in Southwest Atlanta as Thanksgiving meals. Nevertheless, Thanksgiving isn’t the only time when Howard did some philanthropic work.Outside of the court, Dwight donated his time, money, and enthusiasm to community projects, schools, and youth programs, often without drawing attention to himself. When he was a member of the Houston Rockets in 2016, he collaborated with Memorial Hermann Health System to surprise hospital kids.Using Google Cardboard headsets, he offered them a virtual reality (VR) tour of the Rockets' locker room, followed by an unexpected in-person visit to their hospital rooms.Also read: "I just want to say thank you"- Dwight Howard expresses gratitude to Orlando fans ahead of 2025 Basketball Hall of Fame induction
Article Summary: Dwight Howard has always celebrated Thanksgiving with or without his family. With a touching gesture, he jump started Thanksgiving for two women by buying groceries for them. He then posted a video on Instagram showing himself browsing the shopping aisles and lending helping hand to others.
